column1: length, along the line of leg, and defended straight back down the pitch
fuller, straight, and he defends this straight back towards the bowler with a slight forward press
length, more towards off stump, and he stretches forward to defend with a forward press
fuller, towards middle, and he whips it away towards the man at short mid-wicket
ooh, nearly carries back to the bowler! Length ball, just around off, and he stretches forward to defend. Just stops on him a touch, and pops back up a touch. Landed short of Lakmal, though
fuller, wider, and he looks to drive. Off the outer edge, but lands short of point. Some 'oohs' and 'aahs' from the fielders near him
length, wide of off, and left alone
fuller, straighter, and driven back with a straight bat towards mid-on
length, swings away from outside off, and collected high to his right by the keeper
looks to go full, ends up overcooking it, Kasuza looks to whip it away, and gets it away towards square leg. There's a man fielding there
length, and he presses forward to defend towards square leg
full, driven hard, and straight towards mid-on
length, stretches forward to defend this towards point. Pitched around off
length, a bit of nip back in from outside off, and he drives this towards mid-off. Good stride forward to cover any movement on offer
length, outside off, left alone
length, jags back in a touch. He defends from the crease. Gets a little inside edge on to pad, but no alarms particularly
length, outside off, and a good leave. Not far from the off stump, but he trusted the bounce and the lack of late movement
straighter, and he drives this towards mid-on
fuller, wider outside off, and he leaves
first runs of this match Looks for the yorker, and he is somehow able to get enough bat on it. Squirts it away towards fine leg
length, angles in from outside off, and he defends, pressing forward a touch
length, around off, and he drives this to mid-off
length, around off, and he defends from the crease. Just a little bit of movement on that occasion, that made it straighten, and he had to play this late
length, outside off, he looks to leave, but ends up toe-edging it along the ground to second slip as he looks to get his bat out of the way
oh, well bowled! A sharp leg-cutter that whizzes past his outside edge as Kasuza stretches to defend. Too good for him, in fact!
length, goes on with the angle and doesn't miss the top of off by much! Kasuza judges it well, and leaves it alone
straighter, towards the pads, and he whips it towards short mid-wicket
length, zips away after pitching outside off, and left alone
length, he presses forward to defend. A bit of extra bounce makes it hit the top of the bat, close the handle, but he plays with soft hands. Goes towards point, along the ground
length, straighter, and he plays it to short mid-wicket
length, outside off, and beats the outside edge. Masvaure seems to have played inside the line of this. Seems to have been caught in two minds
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
length, outside off, left alone
touch back of a length, and punched away towards point
off the mark at last! Some width on offer, and he can steer this to the right of point, down towards third man. The man at the deep is quite square, and that allows them to come back for the second
strays down the pads with a brisk, length ball. He tries to whip it away, but gets it off the thigh pad towards fine leg
length, but loses his radar a bit. Down the leg side, and a good collection by Dickwella
length, defended around off
flicks one around his pads towards square leg. Wants a single, but sent back by Kasuza. Masvaure had almost come half-way down the track
length, defended towards mid-on
length, defends with a forward press
length, defends this from the crease
length, smacked with the full face of the bat, but straight towards mid-on
length, and he goes back and tries to whip this away. Defended towards fine leg, with a half-appeal from the bowler
length, presses forward to defend
length, and he goes back and bungs this to the right of square leg. Easy single on offer, and taken
length, outside off, and he leaves
fuller, driven back towards the bowler. Just short of him, as he tries to get low down and catch this. Ricochet takes it towards short cover
length, and he presses forward to dead-bat it away
length, around off, and he defends with a forward press. Neat and compact
length, straighter, and he drives this with a straight bat to mid-on
length, outside off, and he leaves. Just straightens after pitching
shorter in length, and he is able to whip this away towards square leg
length, punched away towards cover
length, around off, and he defends with a forward press
fuller, and he plays an attractive drive towards mid-off
length, cracks this away with a forward press, but again cannot get it past the man at cover
length, outside off, and he leaves this
length, outside off, and he leaves again
length, and makes him play again with the line attacking off stump. He stretches forward to defend this
the first boundary of the game! Fuller, wider, and he eases into a languid drive into the deep point fence. Timed well enough to trickle through the thick grass cover on the outfield
length, played towards square leg
short and wide again, and he cuts this hard. Won't go all the way to the fence, but before point can pull things back, they go back for the third
length, wide of off, and he runs it past gully. Just a finger tip on to it, as it goes along the ground, and they are able to go through for an easy single
length, jags back in from outside off, and he defends towards square leg
length, and defends towards short mid-wicket
short, and he ducks under this. Just a touch down leg side, but brisk from Kumara. One for the over called
length, and he looks to defend. This takes the inside edge, and almost goes back towards the stumps. Wasn't threatening off, but he still gets a little shoe on to it to protect the stumps
defends a well-directed short ball, cutting in from outside off, up on his toes

fuller, and he meets it with a full face of the bat. Through the extra cover region, but a good effort from Lakmal going in from the covers saves a run. Forced to put in the dive, and just pulls it back ahead of the boundary rope
length, stretches forward to defend
fuller length, driven hard towards mid-off
length, takes the edge, and lands short of gully! More like it from Vishwa, a good line slanting across Kasuza, and almost getting the error out of him
full ball, but down the leg side, and he flicks this through the mid-wicket area. Good, controlled stroke from him, and placed it well beyond the man at short mid-wicket
fuller, around off, and he drives firmly towards mid-off
length, jags back at him sharply. Loud appeal for a leg-before, but perhaps hoping that this hit the pad first. Kasuza got some bat on this, though
length, around off, and he leaves
length, around off, and he leaves
length ball but way outside off, left alone
short of length around off, hops back and defends
short but flies over the bowler's head
fuller and angling in, gets an inside edge on to the pads
short of length outside off, cuts it towards cover-point
chases a wide one, looks to flay it square of the wicket but manages to get only an outside edge. Dickwella makes no mistake, moving to his left and pouching it comfortably
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards short midwicket
pitched up on the stumps, Kasuza gets under it and lofts it over the bowler's head
too full on the stumps, pushes it back
length ball on the pads, turned away towards backward square leg
flighted, fuller on the leg stump, drives inside out but the cover fielder makes a diving stop
and he's off the mark with a four. Tossed up outside off, comes forward and drives to the right of mid-off. Was in the air for a while but away from the extra cover fielder
a bouncer but too high, Kasuza ducks under
length ball angling in towards the batsman, defended from the back foot
length outside off, pushes it towards mid-off with his feet rooted inside the crease
length ball on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg
length ball outside off, left alone
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
a thick outside edge past the diving first slip. Was angled in at the batsman who looks to stay leg side of the ball and defend
length ball around off and middle, defended from the back foot
a top edge this time, goes for the slog sweep, but fails to keep it down. Luckily it's away from the square leg fielder
length ball around off and spinning in a bit to beat the bat. Hit on the pads but the impact was outside off
fuller around off and middle, comes forward and turns it on the leg side
length ball around off and middle, defended
short of length angling in towards the batsman, Kasuza gets on his toes and looks to punch. The ball hits the inner half and dribbles on the leg side
length ball at the stumps, looks to flick but it bounces a touch higher than he expected. Turned away towards square leg
short outside off and he nails to the half-cut half-punch this time. Hits it to the left of the backward point fielder
fuller on the stumps, looks to drive down the ground but the ball turns in his hand. Rolls towards mid-on
length ball in the channel, left alone
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but once again is trying to hit it too hard. Ends up chopping into the ground
length ball around off and middle, flicked towards square leg
down the track and lofted over long-on, got to the pitch of the ball and did it easily
a paddle sweep this time, gets a single to fine leg
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards extra cover
length ball around off and middle, defendefd
length outside off and spinning away, looks to go over extra cover but ends up chipping it over covers
length ball, flatter on middle and leg, flicked towards short midwicket
length outside off, lunges forward and blocks
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards midwicket
taken at short leg. Length ball on the stumps, Ervine comes forward and looks to play at it with hard hands. Bat in front of the pad, gets an inside edge and Fernando makes no mistake
length ball, sliding down the leg side. Looks to flick but misses
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards long-on
length ball around off, comes forward to block. It turns and hits the bat much higher
flatter on the stumps, goes back and defends
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
flighted outside off, Taylor goes down the track and lofts it over long-off
length ball just outside off, spins away. Left alone by Taylor
flatter outside off, left alone once again
length ball around off and spinning in, gets behind and blocks
length ball again, some turn once again, blocked from the back foot
fuller around off, drives it towards the non-striker. The ball hits the non-striker's bat and ricochets on to the stumps as he tries to get back in his crease. He is safe though
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
drives it towards mid-on and sets off
length outside off, lunges forward and offers a dead bat
fuller around off, drives inside out towards covers
length ball around off, defended
fuller on the stumps, a big stride forward to block
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, defended on the front foot once more
length ball around off, pushed towards short extra cover
fuller on the leg stump, goes for the reverse sweep, and i lobs towards short leg, an appeal for the catch but not out. Replays show it came off the glove
length ball on the stumps, defended
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket
short of length outside off, rocks back and cuts it behind point for four more
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards long-on
length ball around off and spinning in sharply. Punched towards extra cover from the back foot
fuller around off, comes on the front foot and pushes it towards extra cover
fuller on the stumps, defended from the front foot
too full around off, blocks again
connects the reverse sweep alright this time. Was a length ball around off, and Taylor hits it towards third man for four
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
fuller around off, drives inside out towards extra cover
fuller on the pads, flicked towards deep backward square leg
another reverse sweep and Taylor once again nails it. Finds a boundary to third man
a low full toss, comes forward and whips it towards long-on
fuller around off, comes forward and defends under his eyes
length ball on the stumps, lunges forward and blocks again
driven inside out over extra cover. Was tossed up on middle and off, Taylor came forward and just chipped it over
down the leg side and swept fine. Taylor gets back-to-back boundaries. Moves to 33 off 27
length ball on the leg stump, defended with the bat in front of the pads
fuller around off, once again solid in defence
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it on the leg side, short leg does well to make the stop
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep point
length ball around off, comes forward and shoulders arms. Some turn and bounce there
length ball around off, pushes it towards covers
tossed up outside off, covers his stumps and leaves it alone
fuller on the stumps, lunges forward to block, the ball takes the inside edge and goes towards fine leg
length ball just outside off and spinning away. Left alone
fuller around off, punched back towards the bowler
fuller but down the leg side, sweeps it hard and fine to move to 40
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, sweeps it towards deep-backward square leg
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, defended from the front foot
length ball on middle and leg, flicked on the leg side, Oshada Fernando once again makes a good stop at short leg
length, outside off, and he oversteps in the process of delivering. Driven to cover
length, outside off, nips away a touch, and he leaves
fuller, outside off, and he leaves
length, outside off, and he defends. Hint of movement away, but he covers that with a slight shuffle back and across
cracking shot! Length, around off, and full enough to allow him to press forward and whack this back over the bowler. A couple of bounces and through to the long-on fence
length, outside off, moves further away and he leaves
length, outside off, nips further away, and he shoulders arms again
length, and he eases into a drive. Off the outer part of the bat, but along the ground to the left of point
goes for a swipe across the line, but misses. Some good turn on offer, but slow, across him. Dickwella whips the bails off, but that shot was attempted from deep inside the crease
shot! Nails the sweep this time. Takes it from outside off, and smacks this deep into the mid-wicket region. No fielder there, and that makes it a safe shot
presses forward to defend a length ball

fifty for Taylor! They have placed a fielder at deep mid-wicket now, and so he goes finer with the sweep. Short leg has also moved to leg gully, and he was careful to roll his wrists and keep it low and hard to the left of the man there
length, presses forward to defend
full, but width on offer, and he throws his hands at it. Guides it past point, and has enough timing to reach the deep point fence
length, some movement away, and he leaves one pitching outside off
length, outside off, and it leaves him as he shapes to defend. To be fair, didn't play too far from his body, thankfully
length, around off, and he defends compactly
fuller, straighter, and defended towards short mid-wicket

there's the breakthrough! Smart setting up of this wicket by Lakmal, as he hits the top of off with one that came back in off the seam for a change. Kasuza has had so many leave him, that he shaped to leave again, and heard the death rattle of that ball just nipping the bail on top of off on its way through.
presses forward to drive one. Bowled wider by Embuldeniya, and he is able to drive this towards deep cover
shorter, and he goes back and swings this all the way towards deep square leg. Wants to push for two, but the fielder there keeps them down to just one
length, defends with a slight forward press
lets one go from outside off, turning further away
length, and he goes back and punches this towards deep point
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
strays down the pads, and he looks to flick this away. Perhaps brushing the gloves, and then thigh pad, on its way through to the fine leg boundary
length, nips back in, and he defends after covering the movement
length, nips back in, and raps him on the pad as he looks to flick. Loud appeal by the Sri Lankans, but the umpire reckons this may have slid down leg
length, defends this towards point
length, outside off, and he leaves
fuller, just outside off, and he leaves! Not far from the base of off stump, but that has to be a good call from him
defends a length ball around off
length, but straying down the pads, and he can whip it away towards long leg
uses the depth of the crease, and swats a length ball thrown wider outside off towards deep point
shot!We've seen this before from Williams. Skips down the wicket, and takes the ball on the half-volley virtually. Lofts it effortlessly deep over long-on
stays back and pushes a length ball with the turn into him towards long-on
tossed up, fuller, and he defends it from the crease
length, driven to cover
length, outside off, and he guides this between gully and point. Sets off immediately and makes a single quite easily in the end
fuller ball, and he stretches forward to defend. A bit uppish, but well short of cover. Some excitement among the Lankan fielders anyway
oh, that's not pretty! Looks like he wants to go straight over the bowler's head, but ends up getting a skewed leading edge. Clears cover and fetches him two, but that's a strange shot

ooh, that's close, and it's given! Lakmal with another superb bit of bowling. Fuller, and just shapes in from outside off. Taylor just falls over a bit as he looks to defend, getting has pads in the way of his bat as it comes down. Somehow, I thought he knew this was a wicket, and he started walking back almost immediately. It's been a good, enterprising innings, but they would have wanted him to bat through most of today, if not any lesser!

WOW! Contender for ball of the series. This pitches around off, and then moves sharply away off the seam. Raza is nowehere near the pitch of the ball, and has a flailing bat hang loose in the general direction of the ball. He would probably have never lived down getting dismissed like that, though
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
flicks one away towards long leg
hangs back and paddles this away towards fine leg. Pitching around off and turning further away, so a shot that is not short of risk!
length, presses forward to defend
short, and he goes back and punches this to the left of point
fuller, down the leg side, and he sweeps this towards deep square leg
length, nips away a touch, and he leaves this
length, up to him around off, and he push-drives on the move forward. Fielded at cover
full, driven back firmly towards the bowler. Fielded at mid-off
length, moves away, and he leaves
length, nips back in a touch, and he defends this towards square leg
length, just outside off, and he runs it off the face of the bat towards gully
length, from outside off, and he plays this with the turn towards square leg
fuller, outside off, and he drives towards cover
defends, stretching forward, to one tossed up around off
short, and he goes back and plays a rasping cut. No chance for point!
presses forward to defend a length ball, pitching around middle and leg
works a fuller ball on leg stump down towards wide mid-on
fuller, and he drives this past cover. Williams wants a second, but Raza sends him back
full toss, outside off, and he just guides this between point and cover. Timed well enough to beat this heavy outfield
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
fuller ball, outside off, and he plays a gorgeous cover drive again. This will pull up ahead of the cover-point fence, and they will come back for the third

short, and he swats this away, but it is intercepted by short mid-wicket. We might have an injury here, following a sensational effort. It qualifies as a DROPPED catch, in fact, but that is a harsh way to call it
sharp, slightly short ball from Kumara, angles in to Raza. He is airborne as he tries to whip it towards long leg, but is beaten by the sheer pace on it
fuller, straight, and he defends with a forward stretch
short, and he goes back and whips this to the right of long leg. Easy two
length, down the leg side a touch, and he stretches to defend
defends with a forward stretch
shot! Shimmies down the wicket, and takes it nearly on the full. Smacks it straight down the wicket, and is able to place it over long-on
full, sweeps. Gets a top-edge, and it somehow flies over the right shoulder of first slip! Interesting shot that, especially after a six
length, angles in, and he defends towards mid-wicket
short, and he swings this away. Along the ground, and towards square leg. Banged in outside off, but the lack of pace on the pitch shows up
back of a length, shapes into him from off, and he plays it away towards fine leg
length, outside off, and he cuts this towards point
back of a length, and enough time for him to work this towards long leg
short, outside off, and he defends with a little hop
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, pushes it towards extra cover
fuller again, quicker on middle and leg, pushed towards short midwicket
short outside off, slow turn gives Raza enough time to go back and cut it through covers
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, driven back towards the bowler
length ball angling in, hits the splice as Williams look to defend
short of length and it sits up for Williams to go back and pull it in front of square leg. Cracking shot
almost played on. Length ball around off, Williams was caught in his crease. Pokes at it and gets an inside edge on to the pads
fuller around off, drives it towards extra cover with much use of the feet
fuller outside off, the bottom hand comes off as he pushes it towards mid-off
fuller around off, lunges forward and pushes it towards the cover
length ball angling in. Turned towards short midwicket
length ball straying on the pads, misses the flick. Off the pad and into the keeper's gloves. A mild enquiry for caught-behind denied
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards short midwicket and sets off
fuller but on the pads, Williams fails to connect the flick. Into the keeper's gloves off the pads
fuller around off, pushes it into the covers
too full outside off, angling in towards the batsman. Williams jams his bat at it and digs it out on the off side
length ball around off, comes forward and defends
fuller and swinging in, mistimes the flick towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, defended from the crease
length outside off, throws his bat at it and gets a couple as he finds the gap between cover and point. The bottom hand once again came off
fuller around off, comes on the front foot and drives it towards mid-off
short one to get the batsman hopping. Raza finds himself in a tangle, but luckily the ball drops on the off side
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
a low full toss outside off, pushes it towards mid-off
short and just outside off, Williams sways away from it
short of length outside off, pushes it towards cover
short of length outside off, backs away and pushes it towards cover-point
length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg
fuller around off, Williams gets his front foot out of the way and punches it down the ground, beating the mid-off on his left
a bit lucky this time. Fuller and wider outside off, Williams push at it, away from the body. A thick outside edge goes between slip and gully
short of length angling in, defended from his toes
length ball around off, goes back and turns it towards short midwicket
length ball around off, stays leg side of the ball and taps it towards point
length ball around off, defended from the back foot
length ball angling on to the pads, flicked towards fine leg
length ball around off, defended from the back foot
fuller around off, looks to drive but the ball hits low on the bat and rolls towards mid-on
a bouncer outside off. Williams was shaping up for the pull but leaves it alone in the end
fuller, angling on to the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on. A direct hit from Chandimal but Raza was never really interested in the single and had retraced his steps by then
length ball angling away, cuts it towards the sweeper cover for two
length ball around off, tucked away towards square leg
fuller outside off, goes for the cover drive. Doesn't middle it but will get a single to deep cover
length outside off, stands tall and hits it towards point
fuller around off, comes forward and drives but finds extra cover
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-off
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, pushes it back towards the bowler
fuller around off again, drives it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, driven inside out towards long-off for another easy single
short of length outside off, punches sit towards deep point for two more, moves to 49
length ball angling across, left alone
fuller around off, punches it towards mid-off from the front foot
length outside off, goes back and cuts it behind point
length ball around off, stays back and defends towards the bowler with both toes pointing down
fuller around off, looks to drive but mistimes it towards mid-on
and the runs keep coming for Zimbabwe, this time in the form of four byes as Fernando strays one way down the leg side. 200 also comes up
fuller around off, pushes it back towards the bowler
pitched up to the batsman again, pushed on the off side
length ball on the stumps, goes back and pushes it towards cover-point
fuller around off, lunges forward and works it back towards the bowler
on middle and leg and digs it out towards wide long-on
and he gets to his fifty. Fuller outside off, pushes it to the left of extra cover who makes it tumbling stop but cannot stop the single. His third half-century in Test cricket
fuller around off, pushes it back towards the bowler
fuller around off, defended
pitched up on the stumps, defended
down the track and looks to go big. Didn't get the complete hold of it but enough on it to clear mid-on
fuller outside off, drives it towards long-off
short outside off, goes back and cuts it past the cover fielder for a brace
pitched up outside off, driven towards deep extra cover
length ball outside off, cuts it behind point for three more
fuller on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
length around off, punched past the diving bowler to his left
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball outside off, pushed on the off side
length, around off, and he defends with a forwards press
length, width on offer, and he drives. Uppishly, but just short and wide of point
length, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, driven down the ground. Beats mid-on, but will pull up on this sluggish outfield ahead of long-on
fuller, straighter, and quick. Raza jams his bat down on time to defend this
length, around off, and he walks into this to drive towards cover
stretches forward to defenda length ball
whips one straying down the pads towards deep fine-leg
fuller, and he drives this past the man diving across at cover, to get it down to long-off
length, and he pushes this wide of wide cover. Calls through for a quick single
plays the lap sweep, and gets it fine. There's a man at long leg, but this goes through at very slow pace, and they can come back for the second comfortably
length, and he stretches to smother this under his eye
length, outside off, and he leaves
length, he has a jab at it, and misses out. Close call! Wanted to go square, and just didn't offer the full face of the bat as he looked to drive

this is much better! Length, a bit of width, invites the drive, and Williams obliges. Slight movement of the right foot to get closer to this, and then leans into a cover drive, between the men at silly mid-off and short cover. Perfect timing to boot
length, angles in from just outside off, and he defends
length, driven back hard, and Lakmal is just able to rein it in during his follow-through
length, angles in from outside off, and he defends towards point
length, he goes back and turns it into a short ball. Cuts this with the turn towards deep point and picks up three
presses forward to defend a length ball around off and middle
defends a quicker, straighter ball
length, and he flicks this towards mid-wicket
length, quickens up a touch after pitching on leg and straightening, and Raza adjusts well to play it late, off the back foot. Smothered towards point
presses forward to defend a length ball around middle and off
length, and slants in. Well played by Williams, who rides the late movement and plays it with one hand away towards long leg
length, dips in after pitching around off, and he defends pressing forward
length, outside off, and swings further away. Ignored
length, outside off, and he looks to drive it back towards the bowler. Lakmal slips, but is able to avoid any damage during his follow-through. Fielded at cover
length, and he presses forward and meets this close to his body. Allows the ball to move back in and strike his bat, as he defends solidly
length, jags back in from around off, and he defends this close to his body. Trickles away towards a silly mid-on in place for him
typical Williams! Sashays down the pitch, and Embuldeniya shortens the length a bit. Williams goes through with the lofted shot, anyway, and gets it to the long-on boundary on a couple of bounces
length, defended towards mid-wicket
sweeps one that has strayed down the pads, and gets it fine enough
length, down the leg side, and he looks to flick. Misses, and Dickwella is quick to whip the bails off, but he has just grounded his right foot on time
length, sweeps this high, and almost carries towards the man at deep mid-wicket. To his left, and on the bounce, though
defends a length ball around middle and off
length, jags back in, and strikes him on the pad just outside off. Perhaps a bit of an inside edge as well, as there's a stifled appeal from behind the stumps
short, a bit of width outside off, and he creams this through the covers. Will pick up an easy two, as it goes past the man at silly mid-off, and to the left of short cover
length, around off, and he defends
full, down the pads, and he looks to flick. Off the inside edge, on to thigh pad, and down towards fine leg
length, around off, and he defends with a forward press
length, just about jags away late, and Raza has to adjust to defend this. Top bowling again from Lakmal
length, and he goes back to punch this towards mid-wicket
length, and he goes back and plays this towards square leg
length, and he presses forward to drive to short mid-wicket
fuller, and he looks to drive. Doesn't get a hold of this, and it runs along his body and drops at his feet
fuller, driven hard past the bowler towards long-on
length, tries to flog this away through mid-wicket, but gets it off the lower edge. Played towards the man at square leg
length, and he goes back and tucks this towards square leg. Quick single possible, and taken

short, and he has swung this away towards mid-wicket. Fine response from Raza, who had not scored a run in a while. Breaks that drought in some style, swinging away and transferring body weight on to back foot beautifully
length, drives this with some width on offer towards point
that's a bit of an odd shot! A miscued attempted pull, as Kumara goes short outside off. Raza skews this over mid-off, though
Kumara cranks it up again! Short ball, and he ducks under this, and that rushes on to him, takes a toe-end of the bat and runs away to fine leg

short, outside off, and he looks to pull again. Off the bottom edge, and down by his feet. Raza admonishes himself, but must compose himself after this over, which began well, but since there's been some good fast bowling from Kumara
length, around off, and he drives this to mid-off
drives a length ball with the turn towards mid-wicket
tossed up around middle, and he stretches forward to defend
flat slog sweep! Smart to pick that out and go with the turn, and just makes sure he places this well. Goes flat to the deep mid-wicket fence and over it.
length, driven back towards the bowler, fetching it from outside off
length, down the pads, and bails whipped off, but he's always inside his crease during this play
length, and he plays this away towards point, on the move as he stretches forward
length, and he defends from the crease, as it angles in from outside off

WOOF! Short again from Kumara, outside off, and he hasn't taken a backward step. Moves across and absolutely whacks this over the mid-wicket region. That's fifty for Raza too, and he just waves his bat to acknowledge the cheers. Good knock, this, though there's been some good fortune in recent runs
guides a short ball with a hop towards fine leg
fuller, straighter, and driven back towards the bowler
fuller length, towards off, and he drives this to cover
down the leg side. Tries a sweep, but misses out
down the leg side, and he allows this to go through past his left pad
full, towards leg stump, and he plays this towards square leg
length, and he stretches forward to defend this
length, and he goes back and jabs this to the left of square leg. Easy single on offer
fuller, along leg stump, and he sweeps it down to long leg
short, and he is able to swing this away towards long leg with the incoming slant from around the wicket
full, straight, and defended with a drive back down the wicket towards the bowler
length, whipped away to deep square leg
looks to go full, and strays on to the pads a touch. Whipped away towards deep square-leg
length, and he drives this to cover
fuller, and he cracks this towards cover. Half-stop by the man at the cover region, and that will allow them to come back for two
full, and swept away towards long leg
down the leg side, and he pulls out the sweep. Gets it to the right of long leg, but it did travel quite quickly. Only allows the single
short, and he plays this away towards long leg. Will feel he could have placed this better, and perhaps picked up a boundary
length, down the leg side, and he flicks this towards square leg
sweeps one down leg side. A little less power behind this, and that will mean long leg needs to put in some work to his right, and ahead of himself. Quick two taken
full, down the leg side, tries to sweep, but misses. Dickwella whips the bails off, but his back foot was rooted firmly within
length, and he presses forward to defend
presses forward to defend a length ball outside off
length, and he plays this towards square leg
full, and he sweeps towards deep square leg
length, and he goes back and punches this wide of cover-point
length, and he stretches forward to defend
fuller outside off, pushes it towards covers
length ball on the pads, swept swept towards fine to bring up the 150-run stand between these two
fuller outside off, drives it towards long-on
down the ground, reaches to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over long-off, clears with the fielder with ease
length ball on the stumps and swept towards deep square leg for two more

and he ends up playing one shot too many. Short of length at the stumps, goes back and pulls. However, it's not that short and he ends up hitting it much straighter and Mathews comes in from long-on and takes a low catch tumbling forward. He has thrown it away
length ball on the stumps, defended back
fuller around off, pushes it towards extra cover for one
length ball around off and middle, turned to the leg side
works it towards long-on
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, slow turn, defends
fuller on the pads, looks to turn it on the leg side but gets a leading edge towards covers
a thick outside edge as he looks to defends, goes to the right of first slip
length ball down the leg side, tucked away towards short fine leg
a reverse sweep, takes it from outside leg and dispatches it to the deep point boundary
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller outside off, Chakabva goes down and sweeps it from there. Sends it to the deep square leg boundary
fuller on the stumps, another sweep from Chakabva. Two to fine leg this time. A direct hit and an appeal for run out but Chakabva was well in even though he hadn't dragged his bat
fuller down the leg side, looks to paddle it fine but misses
tossed up around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, a big stride forward to push it towards the bowler
length outside off and spinning away, left alone
tossed up around off, comes forward and dead-bats
length ball around off, defended from the front foot
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
full on middle and leg, blocked again
length ball around middle and leg, moves across and turns it past the wicketkeeper, was looking for a quick single but Williams knows there's no need of that right not and sends him back
too full outside off, digs it out towards extra cover
length outside off, goes for the cut but ends up chopping into the ground
flatter and quicker, angling in, Williams punches it towards long-on, moves to 99
length ball around off, comes forward and defends
gets low and takes it on the full from outside off, two more to fine leg
length ball around off, defended from the front foot

and he brings up his second Test hundred. Off comes the helmet, up goes the arms. Applause from his team-mates, cheers from the crowd. Fuller down the leg side and sweeps it and finds the gap between fine leg and deep square leg
fuller on middle and leg, pushed towards short midwicket
another one down the leg side, swept fine this time. Gets two to fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards long-on
fuller outside off, comes forward and check-drives it through covers for another four
length outside off, punches off the back foot towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
pitched up around off, drives it towards long-off
length ball on the pads, nudges it behind square leg
flatter around off, lunges forward and blocks

bowled 'im. Length ball on the stumps, coming in with the angle. Williams goes for another slog sweep but finds thin air this time. Sound of the timber and a brilliant knock from the Zimbabwe captain comes to an end
length ball around off, comes forward and defends it towards short leg
fuller outside off, drives it through covers for a couple
length ball angling in, stays back and defends
length ball at the stumps, blocked
fuller around off, defended again
tossed up on the stumps, looks to push on the off side but the ball hits the inner half and rolls towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, drives it towards sweeper cover
length ball in the channel and shaping away, left alone
fuller around off, flicked towards fine leg for one
length ball around off, tucked away towards square leg

beats the outside edge with a beauty. Coming in with the angle, landing around the fourth stump line, which means Mutombodzi has to play at it but as he tries to lay his bat on it, the ball swings away
a touch straighter this time, Mutombodzi gets behind this and defends
and beaten again. Length outside off, comes forward to defend but the ball moves away to beat the bat
strays on the pads, looks to flick but misses, gets a leg bye to fine leg
length ball down the leg side, goes for the flick but misses
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball in the corridor, left alone
short of length in the corridor, doesn't bounce that much, Mutombodzi drops his wrists to stay safe
fuller outside off, looks to drive down the ground but is beaten as it moves just away after pitching
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball in the corridor, left alone
fuller around off, moves across and turns it towards square leg
length ball outside off, moves across and defends
length ball pitching just outside off and straightening, defended on the off side
short of length in the corridor, shouldered arms
off the mark in Test cricket. A length ball angling in towards the off stump, looks to defend but gets a thick edge towards backward point
slanting on to the pads, flicked towards fine leg
a bouncer but angling down the leg side, Mutombodzi moves a bit towards the off side and bends
another bouncer, much better line this time, just outside off. Mutombodzi hopes but keeps his wrists down. The ball sails over him
another short one, rising towards the batsman who stands tall and drops it down
short of length on middle and leg, doesn't rise that much, tucked away towards square leg
length ball around fifth stump and moving further away, left alone
fuller but similar line, ignored once again
length ball around off, gets behind it and works it on the leg side
length ball around off, tucked away towards square leg for a quick single

length ball angling in, misses the flick and is hit on the front pad, an appeal for lbw but umpire Menon says not out. Was it too high or sliding down? I am not sure either way but that created enough doubt in the umpire's mind
length ball in the channel, left alone
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards fine leg
length but swinging down the leg side, a diving Dickwella cannot stop that
length but once again straying down, Dickwella gets there in time on this ocassion
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
another one on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
length on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg
turn and bounce to beat the bat as Mutombodzi looks to defend this, was tossed up around off
length outside off, defended this time

flighted outside off, Mutombodzi looks to go big and is drawn forward. Dickwella whips off the bails and they are checking upstairs for a stumping. Looks like he dragged his foot back in just in the nick of time. Yes, not out
fuller on the stumps, drives uppishly towards mid-off for a quick single
a full toss on the stumps, sweeps it towards deep-backward square leg
down the ground, reaches to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over extra cover for four
length ball on the pads, goes for the flick but misses. An appeal for lbw but think it landed outside leg
length ball on the pads, Chakabva lets it brush the thigh pad, dribbles towards the keeper
length ball angling away, punched towards backward point
length ball around middle and off, gets behind it and blocks solidly
length around off, defended solidly from the back foot
fuller on the pads with a leg gully in place, Chakabva glances it fine to bring up the 350
flatter, just outside off, Mutombodzi was looking to defend first but withdraws as it spins away
too full around off, blocked
tossed up outside off, left alone
short of length outside off, cuts it straight towards point
length ball on the pads, flicked towards fine leg
length ball down the leg side, Mutombodzi cannot connect the flick
fuller and swinging in to beat the flick and rap him in front, looked like pitched in line but might have gone on to miss the leg stump
fuller on the pads, flicked towards square leg
goes for the yorker but misses his mark a bit. Mutombodzi jams his bat at it
fuller around off, defends it towards the covers, and takes a single
length, way outside off, left alone
length, jags away and beats the bat comfortably. A tentative poke forward from Mutombodzi, without much foot movement at all
takes the edge, but goes along the ground! A bit of swing away, and takes the outside edge as he looks to defend. Importantly, he plays it with soft hands, and it goes wide of second slip
length, straighter, and he defends after getting behind the line of this
straighter, and he works it to the right of square leg
length, around off, a touch low, and he defends, staying low himself
fuller, and he drives uppishly, but gets it past short cover. A bit of work for long-off to get across to the extra cover boundary
skips forward and takes it on the full and whips this towards deep mid-wicket. A chase on for the man from mid-on and that will fetch him two more
length, and he stretches forward to defend
length outside off, and he leaves
straighter, and he stretches forward to smother this
short, and cracked away, but straight to the man at wide cover
length, outside off, nipping away, and left alone
length, around off, and he defends with a little press forward
length, nipping away around off, and he presses forward to defend
shorter, and he spanks this away. Straight to point on the bounce, though

ooh, good ball! He brings this back in from outside off, and Chakabva sets himself up for another around off, that either swings away or holds its line. Cuts back in sharply, and beats the inside edge, and the top of off!
length, nips away, and beats the outside edge this time! Superb bowling again from the senior man in the seam attack for Sri Lanka. With a bit of luck, he could have produced a wicket
length, stretches forward to defend
defends from the crease. Fired in a touch quicker
skips down the wicket and plays this towards mid-on. They take on Vishwa Fernando's arm, and make it
flighted around off, and he presses forward to defend
defends a flatter one around off and middle, spinning away
fired in straighter, and he plays it with a dead bat. Lands well ahead of short leg
length, around off, and he defends towards point
dug in short, well directed, as it forces the batsman to duck under this
length, around off, defended
straighter, and he looks to defend. Off the outer part of the bat, and periliously close to catching him leg-before. Lakmal lets out a yelp, as the ball drops towards cover
length, in the channel outside off, and he shoulders arms to this
length, swings away from outside off, and he leaves
length, and he stretches forward to defend

turns a bit more, and catches the outside edge! Similar to most balls delivered by Embuldeniya this morning - on a length, and turning a bit from off. Chakabva comes forward and gets a faint tickle through to Dickwella. Perhaps the more positive Mutombodzi approach would have helped him more
full, and he drives. Uppish, but short of point
length, turns across him, and beats the outside edge as Tiripano looks to press forward and defend
length, sets up for the reverse sweep, and then leaves. Bowled wide by Embuldeniya
length, turns across him again! This pitch is definitely giving the spinners some purchase! Turn and bounce on offer, and Tiripano had no chance of catching up with that
length, comes back in from outside off. Appeal for leg before, but the assumption might be that this bounced pretty high
length, away from him from outside off. Leaves it, and watches it bounce and carry quite well through behind the wicket
straighter, a bit shorter in length, and he looks to flick this away. Off his thigh, towards short fine-leg, and Tiripano calls him through for a quick leg bye
length, close to his body, and he defends from the crease
length, just around off, and he steers this towards gully on the bounce
back of a length, and he defends from the crease. Takes the bottom hand off to soften the impact
short, goes back and punches it back to the bowler
short, turns away, and he leaves it alone
goes back and punches one pitched further up towards cover
short, cuts it hard, but goes to point
length, and he skips forward to defend
length, presses forward to defend this
length, and he stretches forward to defend
length, jags back in from outside off, and he defends
length, comes back in from outside off, and he defends with bat close to body, from the crease
straighter, on to the pads, and he is able to nurdle this towards fine leg
back of a length, defended from the crease
fuller, straighter, and defended compactly towards mid-wicket
dropped short, and punished! Turned away, and he could use the depth of the crease, and then place it to the left of extra cover
fuller, straighter, and driven to mid-on
employs the reverse sweep. Just gets it past the second slip, and it runs to the left of point
length, around leg stump, and he defends with a forward press
goes under his bat. A short ball, and he was looking to go for the drive through covers, but was falling away as he shaped to play
defends with a forward press
length, defended coming forward
fuller, wider, and left alone
defends a length ball towards cover
length, drives this towards mid-off
short, wide, and he looks for a cut, and misses out. Just past the outside edge. Seems to have held up a bit on the pitch
length, outside off, left alone
skips forward to defend a length ball around off
length, and he defends from the crease
presses forward to defend one around off
length, and he presses forward to defend
full, and he defends with a slight press forward
fuller, wider, and he allows this to spin across him
length, driven nicely towards mid-off
fuller, driven back towards the bowler
dug in short, outside off, and he leaves
presses forward to drive a ball on a good length around off
short, and he goes back to defend this from the crease
length, and he defends with a little stretch forward
length, and he defends from the crease
much more like it! Dropped short, and he rocks back and hoofs this towards the long-on boundary
length, defended
fuller ball, driven back to the bowler
skips down the wicket and plays this to the right of mid-on for a single
fuller, straighter, and he drives this back to the bowler
full, and driven towards mid-on. Played with soft hands, and that allows them to flit through for a single
length, jags in from outisde off, and he defends
dropped short, and he plays it with soft hands with a little hop. Some running for square leg to get to it, and they pinch a single in the process

back of a length, towards the body, and he whips this away towards square leg. The fielder there misfields a touch, and before Vishwa Fernando can come in from deep square leg and send the reply in, they go through for the second
short, and he ducks underneath this
yorker, and played straight back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, some turn. Left alone
length ball around off, punched towards extra cover from the back foot
a touch fuller on the pads, Tiripano goes back and flicks it fine for a couple
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the leg stump, goes for the reverse sweep but misses. A huge appeal for lbw but it might have missed the leg stump
length ball around off, a more conventional approach this time. Defended from the back foot
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
great shot! A touch fuller outside off and he smashes it past the bowler. Didn't bother keeping it down either
short of length around off, goes back and turns it on the leg side
a bouncer this time, angling towards middle and leg, Mutombodzi ducks under
short of length around off, dabs it towards square leg and sets off
length ball on middle and leg. Flicked towards square leg
fuller on the pads, nudges it towards square leg
fuller around off, pushes it towards the bowler
tossed up on a length but way too outside off, left alone
fuller but again way too outside off, ignored
length ball around fifth stump, comes forward before shouldering arms
flatter and quicker around off, Mutombodzi is up to it, comes forward and thrusts his bat at it
length ball on the stumps, punched towards short midwicket
length ball, spinning in towards the off stump. Goes back and flicks it towards midwicket
length ball around off, once again some turn for Dhananjaya, flicks it towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and turns it towards short midwicket
length ball around off, gets behind it and blocks
length ball around off, punched down the ground, Dhananjaya moves to his right and fields himself
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball on middle and leg, defended with the bat in front of the pads
fuller on the leg stumps, driven firmly but cannot beat mid-on
length ball outside off, goes back and cuts it towards cover
length outside off, goes for the cut again but ends up chopping into the ground
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks

Dhananjaya gets his third. Flatter and fuller around off and middle. Mutombodzi goes for the sweep but misses, struck right in front of the middle stump. No hesitation in the umpire's mind; would have gone on to hit middle and leg
length ball but spinning down the leg side, Mumba was looking to flick but withdraws
flatter on the stumps, comes forward to block
too full on the stumps, pushes it back gently
flatter outside off, stays back and blocks
tossed up on the stumps, takes it on the full and pushes it towards covers, the fielder makes a diving stop to his right
a risky single. Fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on and sets off for a quick single. A direct hit would have been close
fuller on the stumps, defended from the front foot
down the leg side and, and Mumba plays a lap sweep to help it to the fine leg boundary
fuller outside off, goes back and looks to defend. A thick outside edge goes past the second slip
fuller on the leg stump, Tiripano moves across and sweeps it hard towards fine leg, not the best of the connection but he gets two nonetheless

and he has chipped it straight to Lakmal, who was a couple of steps back at mid-off. Fuller around off, comes forward and makes a perfect connection, right from the middle of the bat but it wasn't hit with enough power
length ball on the stumps, stays in the crease and defends
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
length ball outside off, a touch quicker. Nyauchi was stuck on the back foot, looks to defend but ends up playing inside the line of the ball
length outside off, opens the face of the bat this time to work it behind point, Mumba is looking for a non-existent second run but realises his mistake just in time
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards short midwicket
pitched up and this time he gets a single, works it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on, Nyauchi wants a single but his partner is unmoved. Retraces his steps in time
length ball around off, defends it towards the off side
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
length ball on the stumps, plays in front of the pad and blocks
fuller around off, goes for the sweep but misses. An appeal for lbw but he's struck outside the line of the off stump
a touch straighter this time and Mumba connects the sweep, finds the boundary at vacant deep square leg area. 400 comes up for Zimbabwe
fuller on the pads and swiped away towards deep square leg, four more to the total. Embuldeniya puts in the chase but is a distant second
fuller around off, mistimes the drive towards extra cover

hit on the grill as he looks to duck under. Was a short one from Kumara, angling in towards Nyauchi but doesn't bounce much. Aleem Dar calls the physio on the field. And he looks fine and is ready to resume
a yorker from Kumara but Nyauchi does well to get his bat down on it, especially after being pinged on the helmet last time
short of length outside off, Nyauchi backs away and smashes it towards point where Dhananjaya dives to his left but fails to hold on
another yorker, on the leg stump. Mumba brings his bat in front of it
length ball outside off, turn and bounce. Left alone
fuller this time, just around off. Nyauchi was playing back to it. Spins past the bat
a brilliant one-handed catch from Dhananjaya. Was a length ball outside off, Nyauchi pushes at it, gets an outside edge low to the right of first slip where Dhananjaya shows great reflexes
length ball, outside off, and he drives through covers
length ball around off, and he defends pressing forward
defends one around off on a good length
length ball in the channel, left alone
length ball around off, dabs it down towards short square leg
length ball angling across, left alone
and he bowls short and way down the leg side, helped past the leg slip. Fernando too gets off the mark with a brace.
length ball once again down the leg side, left alone this time
fuller on the pads, tucked away towards backward square leg
short of length down the leg side, pulls it down towards fine leg for two more
flatter but once again way too down the leg side
much better. Slower, tossed up around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and defends it on the leg side
short of length around off, gets on his toes and defends
length ball outside off, defended towards extra cover
fuller outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover
fuller and wider, Karunaratne pushes at it and gets beaten as the ball keeps going away with the angle
short of length around off, stands tall and defends on the off side
length, straight, and defended
length, and he defends from the crease
length, around off, and he glides this down towards third man
length, nibbles away outside off, and beats the outside edge
length, on the leg side, and he can glance this wide of fine leg
length, wide outside off, and scoots along the ground as he leaves this
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, a bit of width, and he can drive this towards a sweeper out at the deep cover region. Enough space to get two for it
length, nips back and strikes him on the pad as he shapes to flick. Probably bouncing over the stumps, and also the impact may have been marginally outside off
fuller, quicker, and he drives it back to the bowler
short of a length, punched towards point
full ball, flicked towards short mid-wicket. Wants a quick single, but sends Karunaratne back after a couple of steps forward
length, angles across from outside leg, and he defends
fuller, and he comes half-forward to drive. Off the outer part of the bat towards point. A stifled appeal from the bowler. He knows that could have been close
length, outside off, left alone
length, outside off, and he leaves
length, and he comes forward to drive this towards mid-off
length, straighter, and he plays this towards one of the two men on the drive on the on side
floats this down the leg side. Tough one for Chakabva, who can't get more than a little glove on to it. Concedes a bye in the process
full, width, and he drives. Should have been stopped at covers, but the substitute there fails to do so. Concedes two
length, but width again. Karunaratne presses forward and drives to mid-off
good shot! Length is fuller this time, and Karunaratne presses forward and drives between point and mid-off. Runs away towards the extra cover boundary but pulls up short of it
length, defended pressing forward
length, runs off the outside edge, and goes through the slips cordon! Good batting by Fernando, as he takes the bottom hand off. It is placed perfectly between second slip and gully
length, around off, left alone
length, a bit of width, and he cracks a cut away. Cannot go past cover-point
fuller, along the leg side. Not far from the leg stump as it runs off his pads as Karunaratne shapes to whip it away. Trundles away towards fine leg
length, driven towards point
fuller, driven hard back into the ground. Back to Tiripano on his follow through
length, down the leg side again, and he looks to flick. Off his pads, and beats Chakabva through to the fine leg boundary
length, outside off, and left alone
length, around off, cutting back in, and Fernando presses forward to defend
length, and beats him outside the off stump! This holds its line, and Fernando plays inside the line a touch
sprays this wider of off stump. Must have been close to being called a wide. Looks to get the ball to shape away, but starts from way outside off in the process
looks to go full and straight, but strays on to the pads. Fernando helps it along to fine leg with a neat, little flick of the wrists
length, around off, and beats the outside edge this time. It also keeps a bit low as he shapes to defend
length, straight around off, and he defends
length, outside off, and he looks to drive this square. Gets it off the bottom of the bat down on the ground near his bat
length, around off, and he leaves
length, and he lets this pass
length, around off, a little bit of movement back in late from there, and left alone
length, outside off, jags back in a touch, and he leaves again
length, and he defends this towards gully
streaky, but that will do! Length, around off, and he was looking to drive this. Off the edge, and then it hits a bit of a dent around the square, and bounces over slip!
length, just outside off, left alone
length, around off, and left alone
fuller, but starts from wide outside off. Fernando is happy to leave
fuller, straighter, and he stretches forward to defend this close to body
fuller, around off, driven towards point
length, and he drives this to the left of mid-on. Immediate call, and they go through for a quick single quite easily
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, comes back in a touch, but Fernando defends pressing forward
length, moves away from outside off. Ignored
full down the leg side, and Chakabva cannot rein it in. Called a bye
is that a drop? Full ball, down the leg side, and he looks to flick it away. Off the blade, and Chakabva dives away to his left, gets some glove but cannot hold on
presents a straight bat to a length ball to defend, pressing forward
length, around off, moving back in, and he drives this to cover
length, jags back in from outside off, and he defends. Driven back towards the bowler
length, width, and he cuts this away. Lovely shot, as he balances himself perfectly in playing that shot. Pulls up short of the deep point fence
fuller, on the pads. Whipped away towards the man at square leg
length, outside off, and he leaves
length, jags back in from outside off, and he defends this towards square leg
fuller, and he presses forward to defend
length, moves away from outside off, and he leaves
length, outside off, and he looks to defend, pressing forward. Just past the outside edge, though he did withdraw his blade towards the end of that
fuller, straight, and he plays this towards square leg
length, zips across him from outside leg, and he defends from the crease
length, straight, and he flicks this, towards short mid-wicket
length, straight, and he plays this towards the short square leg fielder
length, angles across him. and he defends from the crease, after covering the line across him
length, down the leg side. Fails to make contact, and Chakabva collects low to his right
full, but on the pads, and he can whip this away. To the left of long leg, and that allows them to come back for the second
bowls a rank high full toss on off stump. Slapped away towards deep mid-wicket
short ball, down the leg side, and put away! Just gave ample time on this pitch for Karunaratne to set himself up and swat it away to the fine leg boundary
full toss, whipped away towards long-on
fuller, driven with the turn towards mid-off

Raza provides Zimbabwe with the breakthrough. Another shorter offbreak, spins in, comes pretty slow off the pitch. Mendis rocks onto the back foot and pulls in the air. Mendis nails it into the right shoulder of Kevin Kazuka at forward short leg. Ouch! Okay, replays indicate that Kasuza has been struck flush on the helmet, and not the shoulder. The ball bounces up to square leg, where Mumba takes the catch. Kasuza, however, collapses and has his hands on his head. Srinath, the match referee, visits Zimbabwe's dressing room, and it does not look good at all for Kasuza. He is being treated on the field. Tense faces in the Zimbabwe camp. Sense of deja vu as Kasuza is being stretchered off the field by the medical staff
